medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began before age 9, with a median age of onset of 7.5 years. Breast enlargement was noted to be unilateral or bilateral in various patients, with some experiencing tenderness. In certain cases, there was a progression of breast tissue involvement over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Neurofibromatosis in all patients; additional conditions included tender masses associated with gynecomastia.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was negative for gynecomastia in all patients, but one patient had an identical twin with neurofibromatosis.
medical_history.social_history: Patients experienced significant embarrassment due to breast enlargement, affecting their social interactions.
